JumpScale.portal.macrolib.div_base module¶

JumpScale.portal.macrolib.div_base.macro(q, args, params, self_closing=False, tag=None, additional_tag_params=None)[source]¶

A generic HTML tag macro, similar to div/span macros in Confluence. In practice, this supports any macro in this format:

{{tag_name: id=id1|class=x y x|style=background-color: green|src=123}}

and all attributes will be converted to HTML attributes. To close the macro, use the same macro name without any parameters, like:

{{tag_name}}

Nesting macros is through a number added to the macro name which represents the level, e.g. {{div2}}.

Example:

{{div}}
{{div2 id=left-panel|class=clearbox column8}}
{{span id=span1}}Text inside{{span}}

{{div2}}

{{div}}

The generated HTML will be:

<div>
<div id=”left-panel” class=”clearbox column8”>
<span id=”span1”>Text inside</span>

</div>

</div>

It also allows specifying the tag name explicitly, or adding additional HTML attributes. This is used to implement the input macros, e.g.

{{email}}
will generate
<input type=”email” />
JumpScale.portal.macrolib.div_base.tag_params_to_html_attrs(tag_params)[source]¶
